pullRequest.body:
Also prove some lemmas for `LinearOrderedAddCommGroupWithTop` which are needed for the instance.

---

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go

nodes.body:
### PR summary [7782ba9143](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/13724/commits/7782ba9143165fdc336004d7d494ac7805c6b5c6)

#### Import changes for modified files

No significant changes to the import graph


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|

</details>

---

<details><summary>

#### Declarations diff

</summary>

`+ IsBotAbsorbing`
`+ IsTopAbsorbing`
`+ NoBotAddends`
`+ NoTopAddends`
`+ add_neg_cancel_of_ne_top`
`+ bot_eq_add`
`+ bot_ne_add`
`+ instOrderTopAdditiveOrderDual`
`+ instance (priority := 100) toNoTopAddends : NoTopAddends Œ±`
`+ instance (priority := 100) toSubtractionMonoid : SubtractionMonoid Œ±`
`+ instance : IsBotAbsorbing EReal := WithBot.isBotAbsorbing`
`+ instance : IsBotAbsorbing PUnit`
`+ instance : IsTopAbsorbing (Measure Œ±)`
`+ instance : IsTopAbsorbing PartENat`
`+ instance : NoBotAddends EReal := WithBot.noBotAddends`
`+ instance : NoBotAddends PUnit`
`+ instance : NoTopAddends EReal`
`+ instance : NoTopAddends PUnit`
`+ instance : NoTopAddends ‚Ñù‚â•0‚àû := inferInstanceAs <| NoTopAddends (WithTop ‚Ñù‚â•0)`
`+ instance {Œ± : Type*} [Add Œ±] : IsBotAbsorbing (Filter Œ±)`
`+ isBotAbsorbing`
`+ isTopAbsorbing`
`+ neg_eq_top`
`+ neg_top`
`+ noBotAddends`
`+ noTopAddends`
`+ top_eq_add`
`+ top_ne_add`
`+ top_ne_zero'`
`+-- add_eq_top`
`+-- add_lt_top`
`+-- add_ne_top`
`- add_eq_bot_iff`
`- bot_lt_add_iff`
`--+ add_bot`
`--+ bot_add`
`---- add_top`
`---- top_add`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/no_lost_declarations.sh short <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/no_lost_declarations.sh <optional_commit>
```
</details>

</details>

`add_eq_top` for `LinearOrderedAddCommMonoidWithTop` is equivalent to `mul_eq_zero` for a `LinearOrderedCommMonoidWithZero`, which requires `NoZeroDivisors` - perhaps there should be some typeclass for it, maybe `NoTopAddends`?
Maybe? I'm afraid it would be a bit too niche in use. What would the instances be?

> Maybe? I'm afraid it would be a bit too niche in use. What would the instances be?

It's the same instances as `LinearOrderedAddCommMonoidWithTop` (`ENNReal`, `EReal·µí·µà`, `PUnit`, `PartENat`, `WithTop Œ±`, `Additive Œ±·µí·µà`), as well as one from `LinearOrderedAddCommGroupWithTop`, but for `Additive Œ±·µí·µà` there's also a requirement of `NoZeroDivisors Œ±`
I guess we could have the typeclass then, although I'm still not convinced it would be amazingly useful

This PR/issue depends on:
* leanprover-community/mathlib4#14598
By **[Dependent Issues](https://github.com/z0al/dependent-issues)** (ü§ñ). Happy coding!
<!-- By Dependent Issues (Action) - DO NOT REMOVE -->
Please split the new classes to a separate PR
Please split the new classes to a separate PR
This instance should have priority 100.
Done.
This looks like you have multiple goals in focus at the same time. Please use bullet points to structure your proof.

```suggestion
lemma neg_eq_top {a : Œ±} :
```
```suggestion
lemma neg_eq_top_iff (a : Œ±) :
```

```suggestion
variable {Œ± : Type*} [LinearOrderedAddCommGroupWithTop Œ±]
```
```suggestion
variable (Œ± : Type*) [LinearOrderedAddCommGroupWithTop Œ±]
```

```suggestion
lemma add_eq_top {a b : Œ±} :
    a + b = ‚ä§ ‚Üî a = ‚ä§ ‚à® b = ‚ä§ := by
```
```suggestion
lemma add_eq_top_iff (a b : Œ±) :
    (a + b = ‚ä§) ‚Üî a = ‚ä§ ‚à® b = ‚ä§ := by
```
This collides with `ENNReal.add_eq_top` so I had to undo this

```suggestion
```
I think you should keep this one since it's eligible for dsimp
Does the simpNF linter work for `dsimp` now? I saw there was some talk about that in Zulip, and previously this lemma triggered it.
I'm not quite sure whether it's there just yet (and you will have to merge master), but you can always tag this lemma with `nolint simpNF`
Alright, I tagged it with `nolint simpNF`

Since `Iff` is a structure, you can use `where` notation
```suggestion
@[simp] lemma neg_eq_top {a : Œ±} : -a = ‚ä§ ‚Üî a = ‚ä§ where
  mp h := by
    by_contra nh
    replace nh := add_neg_cancel_of_ne_top nh
    rw [h, add_top] at nh
    exact top_ne_zero' nh
  mpr h := h ‚ñ∏ neg_top
```
Same here

```suggestion
instance (priority := 100) toSubtractionMonoid : SubtractionMonoid Œ± where
```
since it's an inheritance instance

```suggestion
  mpr h := by cases h <;> simp_all
```
Why the `_iff`? It's pretty unambiguous that the lemma is an iff. Compare with `mul_eq_zero`
It collides with `ENNReal.add_eq_top`.

Perhaps there should be some typeclass which `Mathlib.Algebra.Order.Monoid.WithTop` could use, which both `WithTop` and `LinearOrderedAddCommGroupWithTop` have instances of, as I see this is already a theorem there.

EDIT: Actually, isn't this just `LinearOrderedAddCommMonoidWithTop`? It's just that the theorems in `Mathlib.Algebra.Order.Monoid.WithTop` should be moved to it.
Yes, that sounds right

There is a problem that the corresponding theorems on `WithTop` have less requirements. For example `WithTop.add_eq_top` only requires `[Add Œ±]`, while the `LinearOrderedAddCommMonoidWithTop` instance requires `[LinearOrderedAddCommMonoid Œ±]`. How can this be resolved?
You can keep `WithTop.add_eq_top`, but make it `protected`

Can't you align to the general lemma instead?
```suggestion
#align ennreal.add_eq_top add_eq_top -- or however it's called
```
Done.

```suggestion
    zero_mul := top_add (Œ±  := \alpha)
```
Created #14598

pullRequest.title: feat: SubtractionMonoid instance for LinearOrderedAddCommGroupWithTop
